questions.question: Peter's mother went to the market. He went with ..................................
questions.description: We need an object pronoun (him, her, them, us) after a preposition. Note that the pronouns you and it have the same subject and object forms.

questions.question: The children are playing in the park. ............................. are having a great time.
questions.description: We need a plural pronoun to refer to a plural noun. He and she are singular.

questions.question: Tom is running to catch the ball. ........................ is wearing a blue shirt.
questions.description: We need a subject pronoun here. He is the subject form. Him is the object form. His is the possessive form.

questions.question: Reddy Fox saw a monster. The monster frightened .......................
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object should be in its object form. He is the subject form and him is the object form.

questions.question: Don't eat this mango. ............................ is rotten.
questions.description: We use 'it' to refer to things and animals.

questions.question: The students are making a lot of noise. Please ask ........................... to keep quiet.
questions.description: Them is the object form of they.

questions.question: My brother likes storybooks. I bought this for ........................
questions.description: The pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.

questions.question: Nancy is a good girl. Everybody likes .........................
questions.description: Here the pronoun is the object of the verb 'likes', so it should be in its object form.

questions.question: .............................. are going to the cinema. Do you want to come with ..........................?
questions.description: Here the first pronoun is the subject and the second pronoun is the object.

questions.question: Don't eat this mango. I will get a good one for ....................
questions.description: The pronoun 'you' has the same object and subject forms.

questions.question: That dog is ............................ This is .........................
questions.description: His is the possessive form of he. Likewise, ours are the possessive form of we.

questions.question: My daughters like to watch Disney films. This CD is for ..........................
questions.description: A pronoun used as the object of a preposition should be in its object form.
